definition: length (of a piece of writing)/space occupied on a printed page
sheet/piece of writing/bound set of bamboo slips used for record keeping (old)/classifier for written items: chapter, article

sentences.english: The verbal equivalent of about 150 average-length books!
sentences.chinese: 這些字大約相當於150本中等篇幅的書。

sentences.english: This is a condensed version of the Book; it's only half as long as the original Book.
sentences.chinese: 這是該書的縮寫本，只有原著篇幅的一半。

sentences.english: The subject is too vast a one to be treated in an essay o…
sentences.chinese: 這個題目太大了，用這麼長的篇幅難以闡述清楚。

sentences.english: He spends the rest of the book describing how to survive without one.
sentences.chinese: 本書餘下的篇幅裏描述了沒有車該如何生存。

sentences.english: The editorial invests heavily in a family planning policy.
sentences.chinese: 該社論用很大篇幅闡述計劃生育政策。

sentences.english: This is purely due to space limitations in the article.
sentences.chinese: 這純粹是因爲本文篇幅所限。

sentences.english: Most chapters of The Collection of Three Leaves by Guo Moruo are the expressions of the writer′s miserable penitence.
sentences.chinese: 《三葉集》大部分篇幅是郭沫若矛盾痛苦心靈的懺悔。

sentences.english: We would give more examples if we could afford the space.
sentences.chinese: 勻出篇幅來，就可以多舉些例子了。

sentences.english: Paris-Match this week devoted a 16-page cover story to the subject.
sentences.chinese: 《巴黎競賽》本週花了16頁的篇幅做了封面報道。

sentences.english: There are many other features I haven't the space to mention.
sentences.chinese: 篇幅所限，很多其他的特性我不能提及。

sentences.english: The chief objection to this book is its great length.
sentences.chinese: 這本書的主要缺點是篇幅太長。

sentences.english: Code fragments from this sample appear throughout this section.
sentences.chinese: 此處將用整節的篇幅來顯示該示例中的各個代碼段。

sentences.english: Heady stuff that I cannot yet explain, even if I had space.
sentences.chinese: 即使還有篇幅，現在我也還不能解釋其本質。

sentences.english: Lack of space forbids further discussion at this point.
sentences.chinese: 由於篇幅有限，現在不能深入討論這個問題。

sentences.english: The story got extensive coverage on the news.
sentences.chinese: 此事件在新聞中得到了大篇幅的報導。

definition: to say more than is necessary/to give unnecessary details
start of literary work/opening song of ballad in Tanci style 彈詞|弹词[tan2 ci2]
entire book/unabridged book/entire multi-volume work/comprehensive volume
to abridge (a text)/to edit out (of a movie)/to cut back (a budget, a curriculum)
to omit/to delete/to leave out/to neglect/to skip over
